thread.title: Cops: Armed man jumps out of cooler, robs Gwinnett gas station
thread.title_full: Cops: Armed man jumps out of cooler, robs Gwinnett gas station

author: Amanda C. Coyne
title: Cops: Armed man jumps out of cooler, robs Gwinnett gas station
text:
A Lawrenceville gas station clerk was cleaning up shortly before midnight on Feb. 4 when he heard the sound of a glass bottle shattering.
The clerk went to the drink cooler to assess the damage. Inside the cooler, he found a man.
The man jumped out of the cooler and pointed a gun at the clerk’s head, demanding he open the register and hand over the money inside, a Lawrenceville Police Department report said.
The Shell clerk gave the man between $200 and $500 in a black plastic bag and the man ran off on Hurricane Shoals Road.
Gwinnett man sentenced to life for raping girlfriend’s daughter
Gwinnett traffic stop results in arrests for pot, meth, gun possession
Cops found a BB gun in the direction he’d run.
The police have been looking for him ever since.
The clerk of the store, 256 Hurricane Shoals Road, described the man as a skinny with a beard and mustache, wearing a white Philadelphia Phillies hat, black latex gloves, a black jumpsuit, white undershirt and black and white sneakers.
If you have any information related to this case, you can call the Lawrenceville Police Department at 770-963-2443.
